content:
Yes, music can certainly trigger feelings of "setsunai". In fact, music is one of the most powerful emotional triggers and can evoke a wide range of emotions, including feelings of sadness and nostalgia. In some cases, peaceful and soothing music may bring on feelings of "setsunai" because it might evoke memories of a past experience or person that is now gone, and this sense of loss can be deeply poignant and emotional. On the other hand, more upbeat or happy music might also evoke feelings of "setsunai" because it might serve as a contrast to the listener's current emotional state, making them feel even more sad by comparison.

Ultimately, the emotional impact of music is highly subjective and depends on many factors, including personal experiences, cultural background, and individual preferences. So while music can certainly trigger feelings of "setsunai", the specific way in which it does so will vary from person to person.
